title: Visa Hires Chief Marketing Officer From BlackRock; Frank Cooper III, global CMO of BlackRock, will replace Lynne Biggar, who left Visa last month
text:
Before his five years at BlackRock, Mr. Cooper was a chief marketing and creative officer at BuzzFeed Inc. and CMO of global consumer engagement for PepsiCo Inc.'s global beverage group.

Visa said Mr. Cooper will lead its global marketing organization and "guide all facets of the brand from amplifying our purpose through campaigns and activations to delivering value with our global sponsorships." Visa is one of the sponsors of the Olympics and Paralympics, the FIFA World Cup and the National Football League.

Though Visa is the exclusive electronic-payments provider for the Olympics, the company found itself having to share the spotlight with China's new digital currency, the e-CNY, at this year's Beijing Games.

More recently, both Visa and Mastercard Inc. have stopped handling transactions for sanctioned Russian financial institutions in the wake of that country's invasion of Ukraine.

This week Visa said it is "taking prompt action to ensure compliance with applicable sanctions, and is prepared to comply with additional sanctions that may be implemented."
